meanings.definition: A system of mutual suretyship and responsibility among the members of a tithing.
meanings.sent1: In the frankpledge system, neighbors looked out for each other's safety.
meanings.sent2: The frankpledge ensured that everyone in the community was accountable for one another.
meanings.sent3: The frankpledge arrangement made sure no one was left behind in times of need.
meanings.sent4: The concept of frankpledge created a safety net within the village.
meanings.sent5: Being part of the frankpledge meant having a support system in place at all times.

meanings.definition: A group of ten families in early England who were responsible for each other's conduct and for producing any member accused of a crime.
meanings.sent1: The frankpledge of ten families worked together to maintain order in the community.
meanings.sent2: Each member of the frankpledge group had a duty to uphold the law.
meanings.sent3: The frankpledge families held regular meetings to discuss community matters.
meanings.sent4: The bond of the frankpledge families was unbreakable in times of trouble.
meanings.sent5: Belonging to the frankpledge group meant having a close-knit circle of trust.
